headline.main: HILTON CLINCHES STATLER CONTROL; Million-Share Block Defeats Webb & Knapp Proposal -- Board Reorganized

docs.abstract: stockholders approve Hilton control; reject Webb & Knapp proposal; election; C Hilton pres and bd dir
docs.lead_paragraph: Stockholders of the Hotels Statler Company approved yesterday the passing of control of their property to the Hilton Hotels Corporation.

headline.main: SUBSIDIARY SET UP BY HILTON HOTELS; New Company Will Operate in Other Countries of the Western Hemisphere

docs.abstract: Forms subsidiary, Hilton Hotels Internatl for properties outside US; dirs listed
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hilton Hotels Corporation has formed a subsidiary company known as Hilton Hotels International, Conrad N. Hilton, president of the corporation, announced yesterday. The new company will develop and operate hotel properties outside continental United States, with particular attention to commercial and travel centers of the western hemisphere.

headline.main: BONDS MOVE DOWN IN LIGHT DEALINGS; Declines of 1 to 5 Points Are Recorded in Rail List on Stock Exchange. FOREIGN LOANS WEAKEN Federal Government Group Ends Dull Day 4-32 Higher to 1-32 Lower.

docs.lead_paragraph: Domestic corporation bonds and foreign loans were irregularly lower on the Stock Exchange yesterday in the dullest trading in more than a year. Declines of 1 to 5 points were noted in the railroad group, erasing the gains of the previous day in some instances.

headline.main: BOND PLAN OUTLINED FOR BOWMAN BILTMORE; Holders Are Asked to Extend Maturities and Approve Interest Postponements.

docs.abstract: Asks time for payment of bonds and interest
docs.lead_paragraph: George W. Sweeney, president of the Bowman Biltmore Hotels Corporation, issued a statement yesterday to holders of the corporation's first mortgage leasehold 7 per cent bonds, due on March 1, 1934; the 7 per cent sinking fund notes due on Dec. 15, 1934, and the 6 per cent notes (extended) due on July 1, 1933, outlining; a plan of readjustment.
